intro: Poikilogyne cordifolia var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf poikilogyne, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically deep green and glossy. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional medicine practices.
